metadata.name: Potential Discovery Activity Via Dnscmd.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects an attempt to leverage dnscmd.exe to enumerate the DNS zones of a domain. DNS zones used to host the DNS records for a particular domain.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\dnscmd.exe')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/enumrecords')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/enumzones')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/zoneprint')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/info'))))

output.summary: Detects an attempt to leverage dnscmd.exe to enumerate the DNS zones of a domain. DNS zones used to host the DNS records for a particular domain.

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate administration use References: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-server/administration/windows-commands/dnscmd, https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/dns/dns-zones-records, https://lolbas-project.github.io/lolbas/Binaries/Dnscmd/
